channel.title: Object Configuration Viewer [Updated with 100% fixed version!]
channel.description:
After some trial-and-error, I fixed the application and added some more stuff to it. I also included a loc.dat, and added my own object at the end, so there's one fake one ;)
[b][url=http://uppit.com/v/Q1COEJGW]Download[/url][/b]
Screenshot: [img]http://img37.imageshack.us/img37/1690/objconfigviewer3.png[/img]
[s] To use, get Tom's Cache Suite, open the config archive, dump loc.dat, and open it in the viewer. The average loading time for me is about 2-4 seconds, depending on what I'm doing. This cannot edit anything yet, but maybe sometime in the future, I'll add it.[/s]
Made in C#.
~Lin

item.title: Object Configuration Viewer [Updated with 100% fixed version!]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Well, I’m pleased to announce that after some trial-and-error, I’ve fixed it and it loads all of the objects properly. I understand how the “child ID” stuff works, and it works fine. All IDs match, and the objects loaded match the number of objects there are in the file (the first two bytes [11998]). Just lemme finish some display stuff and I’ll be done

Read full topic
